oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Research and Education Farm Droevendaal
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasture and forage crops
Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Education, extension and communication
Landscape and recreation
Vegetables
Root crops
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Fruit and berries
Beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: It covers 50 ha of which 32 ha is actually available for research and education purposes. The remaining 18 ha consist of permanent pastures and nature. Droevendaal is a mixed farm aiming at a closed cycle. The herd comprises of 65 bull calves from Aver Heino, Centre for Organic Farming, for the production of 'organic young beef'.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: {Facility} Droevendaal: Organic Research and Education Farm Droevendaal. Facility Leader(s): Siepel, A., Wageningen University and Research Centre.
